trainerProfile.roles: Powerlifting Coach, 1-on-1 Personal Trainer, Remote / Online Coach, Group / Class Coach, Meet Director / Event Organizer
trainerProfile.facility: I work out of multiple locations

sections.title: Executive Summary
sections.content: This PRD captures the requirements of an independent powerlifting and S&C coach currently training 31 - 50 athletes (Mostly remote, some in-person). The trainer operates as a solo coach out of i work out of multiple locations. Coaching roles include: Powerlifting Coach, 1-on-1 Personal Trainer, Remote / Online Coach, Group / Class Coach, Meet Director / Event Organizer. The interview identified key workflow pain points, methodology requirements (including VBT and RPE-based programming), competition prep needs, desired platform capabilities, and business growth goals.

sections.title: Coach Profile & Practice Model
sections.content:
**Which of these describe what you do? Select all that apply.**
Powerlifting Coach, 1-on-1 Personal Trainer, Remote / Online Coach, Group / Class Coach, Meet Director / Event Organizer

**How many athletes are you actively coaching right now?**
31 - 50

**What's the split between in-person and remote athletes?**
Mostly remote, some in-person

**What's your facility situation?**
I work out of multiple locations

**Are you coaching solo or do you have other coaches working with you?**
Solo — it's just me

sections.title: Current Workflow & Tools
sections.content:
**How do you currently write and deliver training programs?**
Coaching platform (TrainHeroic, TrueCoach, etc.)

**Which coaching platform(s) do you use?**
Teambuildr

**How satisfied are you with your current programming setup?**
6/10 (Cobbled together, barely works → Smooth and dialed in)

**How do your athletes log their training?**
In an app or platform (they enter sets/reps/weight)

**How do you communicate with athletes between sessions?**
WhatsApp

**How much time do you spend writing and adjusting programs each week?**
10 - 15 hours

sections.title: Athlete Profile & Interaction Model
sections.content:
**What kinds of athletes do you work with? Select all that apply.**
Competitive powerlifters, First-meet athletes, Recreational lifters, General fitness clients, Masters lifters (40+)

**What's the typical experience level of your athletes?**
Wide range — beginners through advanced

**How tech-savvy are your athletes in general?**
8/10 (They'd struggle with anything beyond texting → They'd love a polished app)

**How self-directed are your remote athletes?**
Mostly good, but I have to check in on some

sections.title: Programming & Methodology Requirements
sections.content:
**How do you approach program design?**
Depends on the athlete and context

**How do you prescribe training loads?**
RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion), Percentage of 1RM, RIR (Reps in Reserve), Autoregulated ranges, Fixed weight / progressive overload, Velocity targets (VBT)

**What periodization approaches do you use?**
Block periodization, Daily Undulating (DUP), Linear progression, RPE-based progressive overload

**Do you use Velocity-Based Training (VBT) in your coaching?**
Sometimes — for specific athletes or phases

**Which VBT device(s) do you use?**
Other

**If a platform could do anything with your VBT data, what would you want?**
Velocity Profiles, Preparedness assessments, fatigue tracking, load-velocity curves, real time suggested load

sections.title: Competition & Meet Prep Requirements
sections.content:
**How many of your athletes compete in powerlifting meets?**
About half

**What do you currently track during a meet prep cycle?**
Peaking block programming, Opener selection and attempt planning, Bodyweight / weight class management, Training maxes and estimated 1RMs, Warmup timing and logistics, RPE trends going into the meet

**What's the hardest part of managing meet day from a coaching standpoint?**
Warm up room management, warm up timing, multiple athlete flights

**If you had a magic tool for meet day, what would it do?**
Real time warm up timing tool based off of liftingcast data

sections.title: Current Pain Points & Gaps
sections.content:
**What eats the most of your non-coaching time?**
Writing / copying / adjusting programs, Entering or organizing training data, Switching between too many apps and tools, Calculating loads, percentages, velocity targets, Chasing athletes for training logs or check-ins

**Describe your single biggest frustration with how you manage your coaching business right now.**
Teambuildr's metric and data tracking, Teambuildr's UX for programming, too much time spent on programming tasks that could be automated which reduces my time for interfacing with clients, lead gen

**What data do you wish you had but currently don't?**
Long-term strength trends per athlete, Velocity profiles and load-velocity curves, Cumulative volume and load tracking, Training compliance / adherence rates, RPE accuracy over time, Bodyweight and weight class tracking, Just... everything in one place instead of scattered across apps, Injury history and modification patterns

**Have you tried any coaching platforms or tools before and abandoned them? What went wrong?**
I've been using Teambuildr for 5 years and prior to that google sheets. Teambuildr is bugging, lacks useful and easily accessible training metrics and data, programming and planning is clunky.

sections.title: Must-Have Platform Capabilities
sections.content:
**Which capabilities are absolute must-haves?**
Program builder / workout designer, Athlete self-logging, VBT device integration, RPE / RIR prescription support, Mobile app for athletes, Progress analytics and charts, Remote program delivery, Exercise library with videos, Reusable program templates, Client management / profiles, Competition prep tools

sections.title: Nice-to-Have Capabilities
sections.content:
**Which of these would be great bonuses but aren't dealbreakers?**
White-label / branded athlete app, Built-in payment and billing, Session scheduling / booking, Daily readiness / wellness surveys, Sell programs / templates, Nutrition or macro tracking, Community features, Video form check / review, Automated deload / fatigue management, Bodyweight and body composition tracking

sections.title: Mobile & Athlete UX Requirements
sections.content:
**Mobile importance:** 10/10 (Desktop is fine → Mobile-first is everything)

**Dealbreakers:** If the platform doesn't provide a flexible approach for my programming style it is a dealbreaker

sections.title: Business Model & Growth Goals
sections.content:
**How do you currently generate revenue? Select all that apply.**
Per-session training fees, Monthly coaching retainer, Group session fees

**What are your growth goals over the next 12 months?**
Grow in-person clientele, Take on more remote athletes, Build the Cannoli Gang brand, Streamline operations, Produce better athlete results

**What would you realistically spend per month on coaching software?**
$150 - $300/mo

**Which pricing model works best for you?**
Flat monthly rate

sections.title: Priorities & Timeline
sections.content:
**Rank these in order of importance to you.**
1. Save me time on programming and admin
2. Give me better data on my athletes
3. Give my athletes a better experience
4. Help me grow my business and revenue
5. Integrate with VBT devices seamlessly
6. Be affordable for a solo coach
7. Make competition prep easier
8. Be simple — I don't want complexity

**How urgently are you looking for a platform?**
Within 1-3 months

**Anything else we should know?**
All of the current platforms are excellent at one facet of coaching but none of them deliver a fully streamlined, efficient service. It would be great to have the flexibility of google sheets in terms of data and how it's presented combined with the management capabilities of teambuildr.

vbt-dream.value: Velocity Profiles, Preparedness assessments, fatigue tracking, load-velocity curves, real time suggested load

game-day-pain.value: Warm up room management, warm up timing, multiple athlete flights

meet-day-wish.value: Real time warm up timing tool based off of liftingcast data

biggest-frustration.value: Teambuildr's metric and data tracking, Teambuildr's UX for programming, too much time spent on programming tasks that could be automated which reduces my time for interfacing with clients, lead gen

tried-and-abandoned.value: I've been using Teambuildr for 5 years and prior to that google sheets. Teambuildr is bugging, lacks useful and easily accessible training metrics and data, programming and planning is clunky.

dealbreakers.value: If the platform doesn't provide a flexible approach for my programming style it is a dealbreaker

final-thoughts.value: All of the current platforms are excellent at one facet of coaching but none of them deliver a fully streamlined, efficient service. It would be great to have the flexibility of google sheets in terms of data and how it's presented combined with the management capabilities of teambuildr.
